_header: In the month of May when mirths been fele
Subjects: debates; dream visions; hawking; hunting; ages of man’s life; Worthies, Nine; national policy, discussions on
_description: ‘The Parlement of the thre Ages’ — 665 alliterative lines

BLAdd31042.First Lines: In the Monethes of Maye when mirthes bene feleAnd the Sesone of Somere when softe bene the wedres…
BLAdd31042.Last Lines: …There dere drightyne this daye dele vs of thi blysseAnd Mare þat mylde qwene amende vs of Synne
BLAdd31042.Attributed Title: TThe Parlement of the thre Ages (top margin f. 169); Thus Endes The Three Ages (f. 176v)

BLAdd33994.First Lines:
Than fauconers ful frely foundyn hem afturTo helpyn þer hawkis
                    þay hyen hem yern…
BLAdd33994.Last Lines:
…The dere dryghten the day dele vs of þi blisseAnd Mary
                    þat is myld quene amend vs of oure mysse
